definitions.meaning:
[uncountable ,  countable ] the physical or mental energy that you need to do sth; sth that takes a lot of energy 
气力；努力；费力的事

examples.content:
You should putmore effort intoyour work. 
你应该更加努力地工作。

A lot of effort has gone into making this event a success. 
为使这次活动成功费了很大的劲。

Getting up this morning was quite an effort (= it was difficult). 
今天早上起床相当费力。

definitions.meaning:
[countable ] an attempt to do sth especially when it is difficult to do 
艰难的尝试；试图；尽力

examples.content:
a determined/real/special effort 
坚决的╱真正的╱特别的努力

I didn't really feel like going out, but I am glad I made the effort. 
我当时并不很想出去，不过我很庆幸还是出去了。

The company has laid off 150 workers in an effort to save money. 
公司为节省资金遣散了 150 名工人。

definitions.meaning:
[countable ] ( usually after a noun 通常置于名词后 ) a particular activity that a group of people organize in order to achieve sth
 有组织的活动

examples.content:
the Russian space effort 
俄罗斯航天计划

the United Nations' peacekeeping effort 
联合国的维和行动

definitions.meaning:
[countable ] the result of an attempt to do sth 
努力的结果；成就

examples.content:
I'm afraid this essay is a poor effort. 
很抱歉，这篇文章写得不好。
